net.cloud.client.nio

Class NettyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.nio.NettyClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShutdownService

    public class NettyClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements ShutdownService
    The front of the network I/O code. Deals with creating a network connection and initializing the network channels.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ADDRESS
      Network address of the server
      private io.netty.bootstrap.Bootstrap bootstrap
      The Bootstrap object Netty was started on
      private boolean connected
      Flag to indicate whether we are connected to the server or not
      private io.netty.channel.ChannelFuture connectFuture
      The channel future obtained from connecting to the server
      static int PORT
      Port to connect to the server on
      private NettyShutdownHook shutdownHook
      The ShutdownHook that'll take care of shutting down the connection

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NettyClient()
      Initialize to an unconnected state

        public NettyClient()

    • Method Detail

      • startup

        public void startup()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Startup procedure for the client's network communication. Sets up Netty, but will not attempt connecting yet
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If a channel operation was interrupted

      • connectToServer

        public boolean connectToServer()
        Attempts to connect to the server. When a connection is made, then this client's player object is created.
        Returns:
        False if the connection was not successful

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
        Disconnect from the server. This will also destroy the current player object, since it was initially created by connecting. (Reconnecting will re-create). This will not shutdown the netty threads.
        Returns:
        True if the disconnect was successful. Not like we can do much if it isn't.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        True if the client is currently connected to the server

      • getShutdownHook

        public ShutdownHook getShutdownHook()
                             throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Note that this hook is not created until connection is attempted. In other words, it should not be added to a ShutdownHandler right away.
        Specified by:
        getShutdownHook in interface ShutdownService
        Returns:
        The ShutdownHook responsible for this service
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the hook is not available
